A **shimmering dragon**, D, is a type of [monster](/wiki/Monster "Monster") that appears in [SLASH'EM](/wiki/SLASH%27EM "SLASH'EM") and [SlashTHEM](/wiki/SlashTHEM "SlashTHEM"). It is an adult [dragon](/wiki/Dragon_\(SLASH%27EM\) "Dragon (SLASH'EM)") that lacks the [displacement](/wiki/Displacement "Displacement") of its [deferred](/wiki/Deferred "Deferred") counterpart in *[NetHack](/wiki/NetHack "NetHack")* and its counterparts in other variants, but has noticeably higher [AC](/wiki/AC "AC") than the other dragons it appears alongside. Like all dragons, shimmering dragons are [strong](/wiki/Strong "Strong"), [carnivorous](/wiki/Carnivorous "Carnivorous"), [oviparous](/wiki/Oviparous "Oviparous"), [thick-skinned](/wiki/Thick-skinned "Thick-skinned"), can [see invisible](/wiki/See_invisible "See invisible"), and are capable of [flight](/wiki/Flight "Flight") - they will also seek out [gold](/wiki/Gold "Gold"), [gems](/wiki/Gems "Gems") and [magical items](/wiki/Magical_item "Magical item") to pick up.

Shimmering dragons have a [magic missile](/wiki/Magic_missile "Magic missile") [breath](/wiki/Breath "Breath") weapon, a strong bite attack, and two claw attacks. Shimmering dragons possess [magic resistance](/wiki/Magic_resistance "Magic resistance") due to their magic missile attack, and are one of two dragons in SLASH'EM and SlashTHEM to not [hit as an enchanted weapon](/wiki/Hits_creatures_as_%2Bx_weapon "Hits creatures as +x weapon") alongside [silver dragons](/wiki/Silver_dragon "Silver dragon").

## Generation

Randomly generated shimmering dragons are always created hostile. A [baby shimmering dragon](/wiki/Baby_shimmering_dragon_\(SLASH%27EM\) "Baby shimmering dragon (SLASH'EM)") can [grow up](/wiki/Grow_up "Grow up") into a shimmering dragon.

Characters and monsters that [polymorph](/wiki/Polymorph "Polymorph") while wearing [shimmering dragon scales](/wiki/Shimmering_dragon_scales "Shimmering dragon scales") or [shimmering dragon scale mail](/wiki/Shimmering_dragon_scale_mail "Shimmering dragon scale mail") will turn into shimmering dragons.

Shimmering dragons may appear among the hostile D generated in [throne rooms](/wiki/Throne_room "Throne room"), and can also appear among the monsters randomly generated by [looting](/wiki/Looting "Looting") a [throne](/wiki/Throne "Throne") while [confused](/wiki/Confused "Confused") and carrying gold (provided there is no [chest](/wiki/Chest "Chest") on the level).[\[1\]](#cite_note-1) Shimmering dragons may also appear in [dragon lairs](/wiki/Dragon_lair "Dragon lair") and [the Wyrm Caves](/wiki/The_Wyrm_Caves "The Wyrm Caves").[\[2\]](#cite_note-2)

Shimmering dragons have a 1⁄3 chance of dropping a set of uncursed +0 shimmering dragon scales upon death unless [disintegrated](/wiki/Disintegrated "Disintegrated"), and the chance is reduced to 1⁄20 if the dragon was [revived](/wiki/Revived "Revived").

For the deferred monster in NetHack and un-deferred appearances in other variants, see shimmering dragon.

A shimmering dragon, D, is a type of monster that appears in SLASH'EM and SlashTHEM. It is an adult dragon that lacks the displacement of its deferred counterpart in NetHack and its counterparts in other variants, but has noticeably higher AC than the other dragons it appears alongside. Like all dragons, shimmering dragons are strong, carnivorous, oviparous, thick-skinned, can see invisible, and are capable of flight - they will also seek out gold, gems and magical items to pick up.

Shimmering dragons have a magic missile breath weapon, a strong bite attack, and two claw attacks. Shimmering dragons possess magic resistance due to their magic missile attack, and are one of two dragons in SLASH'EM and SlashTHEM to not hit as an enchanted weapon alongside silver dragons.

Generation

Randomly generated shimmering dragons are always created hostile. A baby shimmering dragon can grow up into a shimmering dragon.

Characters and monsters that polymorph while wearing shimmering dragon scales or shimmering dragon scale mail will turn into shimmering dragons.

Shimmering dragons may appear among the hostile D generated in throne rooms, and can also appear among the monsters randomly generated by looting a throne while confused and carrying gold (provided there is no chest on the level).[1] Shimmering dragons may also appear in dragon lairs and the Wyrm Caves.[2]

Shimmering dragons have a 1⁄3 chance of dropping a set of uncursed +0 shimmering dragon scales upon death unless disintegrated, and the chance is reduced to 1⁄20 if the dragon was revived.
